news_header: Five skiers were killed in two avalanches in the French Alps.
news_text: On Wednesday, local officials confirmed that five skiers died in two separate avalanches in the French Alps. Four Norwegian skiers were killed in Val-Cenis, while a Swiss skier died in Haute-Savoie. The Norwegians were part of a group of seven, and three remained unharmed. The avalanches occurred in off-piste areas, which are more dangerous. A mountain rescue team was dispatched for the operation. Additionally, a Brazilian-Portuguese skier died in a large avalanche on Mont Blanc the previous day.
